meanings.definition: In an autocratic manner; with absolute power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The king ruled autocratically, making all decisions without consulting anyone.
meanings.sent2: She autocratically demanded that everyone follow her orders without question.
meanings.sent3: The cat autocratically decided to claim the entire couch as its own territory.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered autocratically, darkening the sky with their imposing presence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher autocratically declared that there would be a pop quiz the next day, much to the dismay of the students.

meanings.definition: Characterized by absolute rule or authority.
meanings.sent1: The autocratic leader made all decisions without considering the opinions of others.
meanings.sent2: Her autocratic behavior alienated her colleagues and led to conflicts in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The autocratic toddler insisted on wearing his superhero cape to bed every night.
meanings.sent4: The autocratic sun cast its blazing rays over the desert, dominating the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The autocratic regime suppressed any form of dissent, maintaining strict control over the population.
